name: Battle Regeneration
description:
The rage of battle seems to make you stronger as the battle gets longer.
: regenerates 1 HP per round while in combat.

name: Cleave
description: Allows to make another melee attack on a near by target upon killing their first target in that same round.

name: Critical Strike
description: Use Dexterity for attack and damage bonuses for melee attacks.

name: Double Strike
description: attacks and to hit

name: Evasion
description: possibility to avoid area of effect damage for spells that do half damage on successful reflex check.

name: Hard to Kill
description:
The rage of battle results in a large adrenaline rush that makes them shake off pain and even death, but also makes them less precise and a little wild in their attacks.
: 50% chance to jump back up to 1/10 HpMax if HP drops below 0 (this check is made at the start of each round)
: -2 to attack rolls

name: Point Blank Shot
description: Allows to avoid the '-4 to attack' penalty when using a ranged weapon with enemies in adjacent squares.

name: Precise Shot (L1)
description: Gains a +1 bonus on attack and damage rolls with ranged weapons.

name: Precise Shot (L2)
description: Gains a +2 bonus on attack and damage rolls with ranged weapons.

name: Rapid Shot (L1)
description: Can make two ranged attacks per round on same target.

name: Rapid Shot (L2)
description: Can make two ranged attacks per round on same target.

name: Sneak Attack
description: When in stealth mode, melee attacks are considered sneak attacks and do more damage (+1d6 for every 2 levels after 1st level) and have a better chance to hit (+1 to hit for every 2 levels after 1st level).

name: Trip
description: Trip an opponent and cause him to become Prone for 2 turns.

name: Two Attacks
description: Allows the player to make two attacks per round on same target.

name: Lookout (Beginner)
description:
A Lookout can spot hidden enemies on the main map by matching an enemy's stealth value. The farther away the Lookout is from a stealthing enemy, the lower the Lookout's chances are to unveil this enemy (-2 per square). It's much harder to spot enemies in unlit areas, like during the night (-4) or especially in complete darkness (-12). Lighting a torch helps here.

The Lookout is also good at preventing the enemy from catching the party flat-footed during the first round of combat.

Uses Wisdom as skill roll modifier. The relevant Lookout skill value is always based on the current party leader's Lookout trait.

name: Shadow (Beginner)
description:
A Shadow can stealthily prevent enemies on the main map from chasing the party by matching their Spot skill value. This becomes easier, if the party moves through complete darkness (+12) or during the night (+4), unless the current square is illuminated, eg by the party's torch. Also distance factors in: at 2 squares distance the diffuclty is at its default value. When coming closer, the diffculty increases by 2 per square. On the other hand, it decreases by 2 per square if goinf further away.

On making contact with an enemy, all stealth is futile (unless the prop allows a stealth pass through).

In combat, a Shadow can help the party to catch the enemy flat-footed in the first round. Furthermore, the Shadow himself can sneak around the battlefield during an encounter.

Uses dexterity as skill roll modifier. The relevant Shadow skill value is always based on the current party leader's Shadow trait.

name: Mechanist (Beginner)
description:
A Mechanist can pick mechanical locks on containers and doors. He can also disarm mechanical traps. All of this gets more difficult in complete darkness (-12) or in the night (-4) on unlit squares.

To use this trait on - partially - hidden objects (mostly traps in this case), the player has to do a SEARCH action via space key next to the hidden object. Searching consumes the time required for ten moves, costs the party leader one SP and can be interrupted by enemies or traps the party directly stands on. Interacting with visible objects (mostly doors and chests in this case) works by just bumping/moving into the visible object.

Uses dexterity as skill roll modifier. The relevant Mechanist skill value is always based on the current party leader's Mechanist trait.

name: Traveller (Beginner)
description:
A Traveller makes the party consume less time per step on main map, effectively influencing the movement speed of the party.

Time consumed per step is shown in the top left corner of the screen. Depending on the scale/zoom level of the current area (close, medium, far) this can drastically change. Please note that the passing of time has effects on various gameplay systems, eg one ration is consumed every 24h hours, the day-night cycle moves on, many NPC/Creatures have time bound movement schedules and some quests require the party to solve them within a time limit. Torches are an exception to this though: for gameplay and balance reasons one light unit is consumed on every step, regardless of the time passing.

The Traveller also makes the party move faster in relation to the movement of the creatures/NPC. Based on a relative speed comparison between the party and each NPC/Creature the chances for NPC/Creatures to skip their turn (0 moves) or to get a double move (2 moves) change. These chances as well as the NPC/Creature's movement speed are shown when you move the mouse cursor over the NPC/Creature in question. This makes it much easier for a party with a good Traveller to run away from chasing enemies or to successfully manouever through patrolled areas. There are NPC/Creatures that will always move slowly, regardless of party speed, because they simply do not try to move fast (mostly civilian NPC around cities and villages).

Uses constitution as skill roll modifier. The relevant Traveller skill value is always based on the current party leader's Traveller trait.

name: Sage (Beginner)
description:
A Sage is versed in all kinds of arcane and mythical lore. Sages can reveal and decipher obscure lore or strange phenomenons. They can also perform rituals that unveil magically concealed doors.

Both is done by performing a SEARCH action (via space key) next to the information or the concealed door. All of this gets more difficult in complete darkness (-12) or in the night (-4) on unlit squares.

Searching consumes the time required for ten moves, costs the party leader one SP and can be interrupted by enemies or traps the party directly stands on.

Uses intelligence as skill roll modifier. The relevant Sage skill value is always based on the current party leader's Sage trait.

name: Runemaster (Beginner)
description:
A Runemaster can break runes used as magic seals on doors or chests. He can also disenchant magical runes that act as traps. All of this gets more difficult in complete darkness (-12) or in the night (-4) on unlit squares.

To use this trait on - partially - hidden objects (mostly magical traps in this case), the player has to do a SEARCH action via space key next to the hidden object. Searching consumes the time required for ten moves, costs the party leader one SP and can be interrupted by enemies or traps the party directly stands on. Interacting with visible objects (mostly rune sealed doors and chests in this case) works by just bumping/moving into the visible object.

Uses intelligence as skill roll modifier. The relevant Runemaster skill value is always based on the current party leader's Runemaster trait.

name: Investigator (Beginner)
description:
An Investigator is trained to find hidden clues with a keen eye for details and an inquisitive mind. This ranges from hidden evidence in crime scenes, tracks in the woods or buried treasures up to physically concealed secret doors and their workings.

All of this is done by performing a SEARCH action (via space key) next to the information or the physically concealed door. It gets more difficult in complete darkness (-12) or in the night (-4) on unlit squares.

Searching consumes the time required for ten moves, costs the party leader one SP and can be interrupted by enemies or traps the party directly stands on.

Uses wisdom as skill roll modifier. The relevant Investigator skill value is always based on the current party leader's Investigator trait.

name: Athlete (Beginner)
description:
An Athlete is versed in climbing obstacles, jumping over pits and swimming.

Climbing and jumping get more difficult in complete darkness (-12) or in the night (-4) on unlit squares.

Interacting with visible objects (mostly cliffs/walls and pits/chasms in this case) works by just bumping/moving into the visible object.

Uses strength as skill roll modifier. The relevant Athlete skill value is always based on the current party leader's Athlete trait.

name: Strongman (Beginner)
description:
A Strongman can push heavy objects like barrels or even moveable stoneblocks. Furthermore, he can smash through various obstacles, like thin, already cracked stone walls. Strongmen are also natural miners.

Interacting with visible revelant objects (eg moveable stoneblocks, cracked walls or ressource deposits) works by just bumping/moving into these objects.

Uses strength as skill roll modifier. The relevant Strongman skill value is always based on the current party leader's Strongman trait.

name: Bluff (L1)
description: Useful in conversations for influencing others. Uses Intelligence as a modifier.

name: Bluff (L2)
description: Useful in conversations for influencing others. Uses Intelligence as a modifier.

name: Diplomacy (L1)
description: Useful in conversations for influencing others. Uses Charisma as a modifier.

name: Diplomacy (L2)
description: Useful in conversations for influencing others. Uses Charisma as a modifier.

name: Disable Device (L1)
description: Chance to pick a lock or disarm a trap.

name: Disable Device (L2)
description: Chance to pick a lock or disarm a trap.

name: Intimidate (L1)
description: Useful in conversations for influencing others. Uses Strength as a modifier.

name: Intimidate (L2)
description: Useful in conversations for influencing others. Uses Strength as a modifier.

name: Pick Pocket (L1)
description: Ability to try and pick the pockets of an unsuspecting target.

name: Pick Pocket (L2)
description: Ability to try and pick the pockets of an unsuspecting target.

name: Spot (L1)
description: Ability to detect traps, spot signs of enemies, etc.

name: Spot (L2)
description: Ability to detect traps, spot signs of enemies, etc.

name: Stealth (L1)
description: Ability to move undetected.

name: Stealth (L2)
description: Ability to move undetected.
